titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Charles Francis Sloane papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kendra Tsai, revised by Loralee Sepsey

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-04-25T12:07-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Revised to add creator's slides description labels by Loralee Sepsey, edited by Liz Phillips.
Revised to add description of log book from donor.
Declassified material returned to file by Sarah Patton.
Container list added by Kendra Tsai.

physdesc.extent: 14 manuscript boxes, 4 oversize boxes, 1 oversize folder

did.abstract: The Charles Francis Sloane papers consist of scrapbooks, writings, correspondence, public safety publications, photographs, slides, and other materials that primarily relate to police training, counter-insurgency warfare, and South Vietnamese police activities during the Vietnam War.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Charles Francis Sloane papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2009.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Trooper, New York State Police, Oneida, NY
Civilian Chief of Police (Patrol Supervisor), US Naval Training Station, US Navy Department, Sampson, NY
Senior Personnel Technician, Examinations Division, New York State Department of Civil Service, Albany, NY
Organized the Vietnamese National Police Academy
Police Advisor, Michigan State University Viet Nam Advisory Group, Saigon, Vietnam
Worked for the United States State Department (Agency for International Development)
Deputy Chief of Field Operations, Saigon, Vietnam
Assistant Coordinator of VN Affairs, Washington, D.C.
Provincial Public Safety Chief, Dacca, East Pakistan
Deputy Assistant Public Safety Officer (Field Operations), Vietnam
Training Advisor/Inspections (Saigon) and Regional Training Advisor (Can Tho), Vietnam
Instructor/Administrative Officer, Management Systems Section, International Police Academy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Charles Francis Sloane papers consist of scrapbooks, writings, correspondence, public safety publications, photographs, slides, and other materials that primarily relate to police training, counter-insurgency warfare, and South Vietnamese police activities during the Vietnam War.

The scrapbooks primarily document Sloane’s experiences in numerous positions throughout New York State and his work for the United States State Department Agency for International Development (AID). The remainder of the collection documents Sloane’s work experience in public safety in Vietnam. Many photographs and documents reveal events surrounding public safety training and recognition ceremonies. More specifically, numerous photographs relate to United States Operations Mission (USOM), Vietnam, the Joint United States Public Affairs Office (JUSPAO), and dinner receptions.
Materials are arranged in chronological order or by the original order of the creator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains career-related material, including employment documentation, correspondence, personnel records, certificates of recognition, agendas, rosters, reports, memoranda, photographs, handwritten notes, documents about Buddhist incidents, police documents, a daily log, two interviews on microfilm, and identification items primarily used during Sloane's time working for New York State and the Agency for International Development (AID) in Vietnam.

The series also includes documents about Sloane's involvement in Santa Barbara County as a student at Santa Barbara City College and as a member of a photo club and the Board of Directors of Senior Programs of Santa Barbara. Professional records are primarily composed of police training records, directories, listings, resumes, rosters, glossaries, notes, syllabi, agendas, and related records pertaining to Sloane’s profession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook is composed of Sloane’s reports, correspondence, news clippings, personnel records, certificates of recognition, writings, and examination records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook is primarily composed of personnel records, performance evaluations, requests for official travel, identification cards, news clippings, correspondence, resumes, memoranda, certificates of recognition, position descriptions, school reports, and notices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook is primarily composed of certificates of recognition, advertisements, correspondence, identification cards, grade reports, news clippings, and personal qualification statements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks are primarily composed of certificates of recognition, news clippings, memoranda, correspondence, invitations, and an evaluation form that pertains to Sloane's news articles, receptions with important persons, and his profession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks are primarily composed of memoranda, correspondence, notification of personnel action forms, photographs, requests for travel, documents pertaining to the Agency for International Development (AID), resumes, news clippings, and certificates of recognition that pertain to Sloane's profession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks are primarily composed of photographs, requests for travel, notification of personnel action forms, certificates of recognition, correspondence, performance evaluation reports, memoranda, end-of-tour reports, and descriptions of duties that pertain to Sloane's profession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains materials related to public safety, including articles from magazines and journals, policies, manuals, newsletters, reports, lectures, legal documents, bulletins, brochures, and booklets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains materials related to Vietnam and not directly about public safety. These items include reports, news clippings, journals, bulletins, newsletters, magazines, statistical yearbook, papers, manuals, books, booklets/pamphlets, handbooks, and briefing folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About police work, monthly reports, and Vietnam.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Covers Sloane’s police news articles, the Agency for International Development (AID), Vietnam, Pakistan, insurance policies, the National Police, and public safety.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes descriptions, loose photographs, a scrapbook about narcotics, and photographs in albums with captions. Photographs show Vietnam police activities, incidents in Vietnam, and dinner receptions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Slides in order by creator's slide carousel as numbered on dot labels on the original boxes. Notes on each set of slides duplicated from creator's labels on the slide boxes. Some instances have significant detail on sets of slides, while others have more minimal descriptions. The numeric sequence does not include 11-12 and 18-20.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1955-1960, Market Places, etc.; Chinese Dr., 94-95.

scopecontent.p: Saigon Markets, etc.; Ektachrome Red; Market Places and Various Gardens; 31-36: Watering; 37: Funeral; 44-50: Buddhist Temple; 51: October 26th 1955, Dien-at Freedra, Home of French High Commissioner for China; 61-63: Office Party; 73-74: Funeral; 76-79: Old Chinese Artists; 80-87: Store Merchandise; 88: General-'TET'.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1-16: Orphanage; 18-33: Trip with Shelby to Qui Nhon; 35-93: Trip with Ryan and Vic Stricker Hoach Int. to Ban Mi Thuot, Pleeker, and Kontura-Monteguard. Return via coast and to Cap St. Jacques Police Academy; 94-99: Independence Police Reader and Preach Governor General: China.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

did.unittitle: 13. I-Corps, 1962-1964; Tray 10; 1962-1964 North Central Lawlands Region, Huc and five provinces

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1-20: Travel via Helicopter with American military to ashon valley on border of Laos; 22-62: Emperors tombs, Ming Mang; 64-83: US Advisor effort showing how hamlet can defend itself. Helicopter comes to rescue, but not at night. At night village is alone.

did.unittitle: 14. I-Corps, 1962-1964; 1962-1964: North Central Lowlands, here and 5 provinces

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1-5: Short visit to Ban Me Phuot; 6: Pleiku Airport; 7-15: French resort atop mountain overlooking China Sea; 16-20: Ceremony at Maag compound Hue re Assassen, of President Kennedy, Nov. 3 1963; 22-23: Trip to Qui Nhon; 24-30: Flight in area around Da Naag; 32-38: Trip so. of Da Naag to Confucian temple; 39-45: Quang Trinh province; 46-63: To Quang Ngai province; 65-85: Flying over VN; 86-94: Ngo Diah Can's weekend retreat, Thua Thien province, en route to Ta Anh beach.

did.unittitle: 15. I-Corps and Saigon, Diem Coup, Nov. 1963; Nov. 1963, Ngo Dienh, Diem Coup, Saigon,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1-14; 15-26: Hue Ngo Dinh Banh's temple, was nearing completion, makeshift prison, etc.; 27-52: Cham Moreau Danang, marble mountain boy carving marble; 53-94: Trips to Khe Danh, on Laotian border visit Eugenia and Millers, Ora Moss; 95-100: Trip to Nam Dong, Thua Thien Province with Province Chief and Regional Police Director. One week later camp overrun by VC; Jerry Hicket was in camp during attack.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1-8: Visiting advisors in Provinces out of Saigon in Delta; 9-19: Walter going home party at tour Dan Nhut, late 1964; 21-44: Delta, last few back to Saigon (outskirts); 46-69: Visit to Cham Village without food for several weeks because occupied by VC, Phan Thiet Binh Thuan Provinces; 68-70: Children's leprosy colony; 70-75: En route to Phan rice harvest, Ninh Thuan Province on range at Phan Thiet; 77-80; 1969, 82-99: Viet Paintings and Viet Prophet Catholic Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1-33: Saigon, various; 35-45: 1969, April, 10-day trip to I-Corp Advisors, Quang Ngai, Steve Rimmer; 46-98: City of Hue showing damage by rioters, later VC, our old home and USIS, Consulate etc., RR bridge replaced by Pontoon bridge, last slide Province of Quang Tri.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1-17: Viet Painting, Oriental Antiques, National Police Talent Center Saigon; 20-26: Trip to Pleiker; 27-35: 1992, takedurivist Saigon; 37-62: Back and forth to Cautho from Saigon and stationed there; 64-91: New Buddhist cult, starting in Cautho, temple next to my apt. house, 1st party-opening temple, American folk to stay indoors; 92-100: Antiques, Cautho.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1-46: With Geo and Mary Newman and 2 Girls from MSU/Vietnam; 48-100: Angkor Wat and Rundletts and Melv Handville, 1959.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1-35: Viet artifacts, Tony Cistano, Washington 1973.
